1.text: To the chief Musician, Altaschith, Michtam of David; when Saul sent, and they watched the house to kill him. Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.

2.text: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.

3.text: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O LORD.

4.text: They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.

5.text: Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.

6.text: They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

7.text: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?

8.text: But thou, O LORD, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.

9.text: Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.

10.text: The God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.

11.text: Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.

12.text: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.

13.text: Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.

14.text: And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

15.text: Let them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied.

16.text: But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.

17.text: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.
